intro: Lastreopsis subrecedens, commonly known as the creeping lastreopsis, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences.
